intro: Herminium forceps, commonly known as the narrow-leafed orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. The plant features slender, upright stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, with a distinctive lip that is usually darker in color. Herminium forceps is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in association with other orchid species in its habitat.
